DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : The prevalence health risk behaviours grow amongst South African employee . Health risk behaviour identify major contributor reduce health relate quality life ( HRQoL ) increase prevalence non-communicable disease . Worksite wellness programme promise promote behaviour change amongst employee improve HRQoL . Aims : The aim study evaluate short-term efficacy employee wellness programme HRQoL , health behaviour change , level self efficacy , pain intensity , body mass index ( BMI ) absenteeism amongst clothe textile manufacture employee . Methods : The study randomise control trial consist 80 participant three clothe manufacture company South Africa . The experimental group subject wellness programme base principle cognitive behaviour therapy ( CBT ) well weekly supervise exercise class six week . The control group receive once-off health promotion talk various educational pamphlet , intervention . Measurements record baseline six week post-intervention . Outcome measure use include EQ-5D , Brief Pain Inventory-SF , Stanford Exercise Behaviours Scale , Stanford Self-Efficacy Scale , Stanford Self-Rated Health Scale , BMI absenteeism . Data Analysis : All data analyse Statistica-8 software program . Although t-tests commonly use statistical method evaluate difference mean two group ( e.g . control experimental ) , assume variable normally distribute . Thus , ordinal data normally distribute , non-parametric test use evaluate difference median two group determine level significance . The Sign test use place pair t-test determine within group change . The Mann-Whitney U test use place independent t-test determine difference two group .
